intro: Dichapetalum morenoi, commonly known as the Moreno's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Dichapetalum morenoi is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native range.
